query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 «Vexilla regis prodeunt inferni 2 verso di noi; però dinanzi mira», 3 disse ’l maestro mio, «se tu ’l discerni».
query.result:
**English:**
1 "The banners of the king of hell advance 2 towards us; but look ahead," 3 said my master, "if you can make them out."
**Sanskrit:**
1 Vexilla rājñaḥ narakasya pravṛttāni 2 asmābhiḥ prati; tathāpi agre avalokayasva, 3 ity abravīt mama guruḥ, "yadi tāni paśyasi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Come quando una grossa nebbia spira, 5 o quando l’emisperio nostro annotta, 6 par di lungi un molin che ’l vento gira,
7 veder mi parve un tal dificio allotta; 8 poi per lo vento mi ristrinsi retro 9 al duca mio, ché non lì era altra grotta.
query.result:
**English:**
4 As when a thick fog breathes, 5 or when our hemisphere darkens, 6 a mill that the wind turns seems far off to appear;
7 such a structure I seemed to see allotted; 8 then because of the wind I drew back behind 9 my leader, for there was no other shelter.
**Sanskrit:**
4 Yathā kadācid ghanā meghaḥ śvasiti, 5 Athavā yadā asmākam ardhagobhaḥ rātrim bhavati, 6 Dūrato dṛśyate yantraṃ yat vāyuḥ pravartayati,
7 Tādṛśaṃ me dṛṣṭam sthānam nirdhāritam; 8 Tataḥ vāyunā aham samkocitaḥ paścāt 9 Mama netāram agam, tatra anyā guhā nāsti hi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Già era, e con paura il metto in metro, 11 là dove l’ombre tutte eran coperte, 12 e trasparien come festuca in vetro.
query.result:
**English:**
10 It was already time, and I relate it with fear, 11 when all the shadows were covered there, 12 and they shone through like a straw in glass.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Āsīt ca, bhayena ca tat kāvyena vakṣyāmi, 11 Yatra chāyāḥ sarvāḥ ācchāditāḥ āsīt, 12 Ca prakāśante sma nalikā iva kācamadhye.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 Altre sono a giacere; altre stanno erte, 14 quella col capo e quella con le piante; 15 altra, com’ arco, il volto a’ piè rinverte.
query.result:
**English:**
13 Others are lying down; others are standing upright, 14 that one with its head and that one with its soles; 15 another, like a bow, bends its face to its feet.
**Sanskrit:**
13 Anyāḥ śayante; anyāḥ tiṣṭhanti utthitāḥ, 14 Sā śirasā sā pādayoḥ; 15 Anyā dhanuḥvat pādayoḥ śiraḥ pravartayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Quando noi fummo fatti tanto avante, 17 ch’al mio maestro piacque di mostrarmi 18 la creatura ch’ebbe il bel sembiante,
19 d’innanzi mi si tolse e fé restarmi, 20 «Ecco Dite», dicendo, «ed ecco il loco 21 ove convien che di fortezza t’armi».
query.result:
**English:**
16 When we had advanced so far, 17 that it pleased my master to show me 18 the creature that had the beautiful form,
19 he removed himself from before me and made me stop, 20 saying, "Behold Dite, and behold the place 21 where it is necessary for you to arm yourself with strength."
**Sanskrit:**
16 Yada vayam pravṛttāḥ smaḥ tāvat, 17 Yathā mama gurve rocate darśayitum mama 18 Tām sṛṣṭim yasya rūpam śubham āsīt,
19 Mama agre apavartata ca akārṣīt mama sthānam, 20 "Paśya Ditem", iti vadan, "iti ca sthānam 21 Yatra te śauryeṇa āveṣṭitum ucitam".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Com’ io divenni allor gelato e fioco, 23 nol dimandar, lettor, ch’i’ non lo scrivo, 24 però ch’ogne parlar sarebbe poco.
query.result:
**English:**
22 How I became frozen and faint then, 23 do not ask me, reader, for I do not write it, 24 because all speech would fall short.
**Sanskrit:**
22 Katham aham tadā hīnaśaktiḥ śītaśca abhavam, 23 na tat पृच्छ, vācaka, yataḥ aham tat na likhāmi, 24 yataḥ sarvaṃ vaktṛtvam alpam eva bhavet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Io non mori’ e non rimasi vivo; 26 pensa oggimai per te, s’hai fior d’ingegno, 27 qual io divenni, d’uno e d’altro privo.
query.result:
**English:**
25 I did not die, and I did not remain alive; 26 now think for yourself, if you have a spark of intelligence, 27 what I became, deprived of both life and death.
**Sanskrit:**
25 Na mṛto 'ham na jīvo 'bhavāmi; 26 cintaya tvam idānīm ātmanaḥ, yadi prajñā te 'sti, 27 kaḥ sambabhūva aham ubhayataḥ śūnyaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Lo ’mperador del doloroso regno 29 da mezzo ’l petto uscia fuor de la ghiaccia; 30 e più con un gigante io mi convegno,
31 che i giganti non fan con le sue braccia: 32 vedi oggimai quant’ esser dee quel tutto 33 ch’a così fatta parte si confaccia.
query.result:
**English:**
28 The emperor of the sorrowful kingdom 29 emerged from the ice up to the middle of his chest; 30 and I had more in common with a giant,
31 than the giants have with their arms: 32 now you can see how huge that whole thing must be 33 to be proportionate to such a part.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Duḥkhamayarājyasya samrāṭ 29 Madhyāt stanānām bahiḥ ājagāma himamāt, 30 Tataś ca aham ekena dānavendrena saha abhisambhāṣaṇam cakāra,
31 Yathā dānavāḥ svakīyair bāhubhiḥ na kurvanti: 32 Adhunā jānīhi yāvatī mātrotīrṇā asti sā sarvā, 33 Yā evamrūpāya bhāgāya anurūpā asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 S’el fu sì bel com’ elli è ora brutto, 35 e contra ’l suo fattore alzò le ciglia, 36 ben dee da lui procedere ogne lutto.
query.result:
**English:**
34 If he was as beautiful as he is now ugly, 35 and raised his eyes against his Maker, 36 then every sorrow must proceed from him.
**Sanskrit:**
34 Yadi saḥ evaṃ sundaraḥ āsīt yathā ayam adhunā kṣataḥ, 35 Evaṃ ca svakartuḥ prati kṣiptavan akṣī, 36 Tasmāt eva sarvaḥ śokaḥ pravartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Oh quanto parve a me gran maraviglia 38 quand’ io vidi tre facce a la sua testa! 39 L’una dinanzi, e quella era vermiglia;
40 l’altr’ eran due, che s’aggiugnieno a questa 41 sovresso ’l mezzo di ciascuna spalla, 42 e sé giugnieno al loco de la cresta:
43 e la destra parea tra bianca e gialla; 44 la sinistra a vedere era tal, quali 45 vegnon di là onde ’l Nilo s’avvalla.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Oh, how great a marvel it seemed to me 38 when I saw three faces on his head! 39 One in front, and that was vermilion;
40 the other two were joined to this one 41 above the middle of each shoulder, 42 and they met at the place of the crest:
43 and the right one seemed to be between white and yellow; 44 the left one, to look at, was such 45 as those who come from where the Nile descends.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Aha, katham atiśayaviśmayam mayi jātam 38 yadā aham tasya mastake trivaktrāṇi apaśyam! 39 Ekam agre, tat ca raktavarṇam āsīt;
40 anye dve ete, ye asyai samyukte āstām 41 ubhayoḥ skandhayoh madhye, 42 ca śikhāyāḥ sthāne sammilitau:
43 ca dakṣiṇam śukla-pīta-varṇayor madhye iva ābhāsata; 44 vāmaṃ tu dṛṣṭum tādṛśam āsīt, yathā 45 ye Nile nadeḥ utpatti-sthānāt āgacchanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Sotto ciascuna uscivan due grand’ ali, 47 quanto si convenia a tanto uccello: 48 vele di mar non vid’ io mai cotali.
query.result:
**English:**
46 Beneath each one emerged two mighty wings, 47 as befitting such a bird: 48 I never saw sails on the sea like them.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Adhastād ekaikasyāpi niryāte sma mahānau pakṣau, 47 yathā yuktāv āstām tādṛśasya pakṣiṇaḥ: 48 na kadācid adṛkṣam samudre tādṛśī vele.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Non avean penne, ma di vispistrello 50 era lor modo; e quelle svolazzava, 51 sì che tre venti si movean da ello:
52 quindi Cocito tutto s’aggelava.
query.result:
**English:**
49 They had no wings, but of a bat 50 was their fashion; and they fluttered them, 51 so that three winds were stirred up by them:
52 Cocytus was frozen entirely by this.
**Sanskrit:**
49 Na teṣām pakṣāḥ āsann api tu vaṭavānalasya 50 ākāraḥ āsīt; tāśca pakṣāḥ calanti sma, 51 yataḥ tribhiḥ vāyubhiḥ saṃyutaḥ āsīt:
52 tataḥ sarvaḥ eva cocitaḥ śītalīkṛtaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
53 Con sei occhi piangëa, e per tre menti 54 gocciava ’l pianto e sanguinosa bava.
55 Da ogne bocca dirompea co’ denti 56 un peccatore, a guisa di maciulla, 57 sì che tre ne facea così dolenti.
query.result:
**English:**
53 With six eyes he wept, and down three chins 54 the tears and bloody foam ran mingled; 55 with every mouth, like a mill-wheel, he crushed 56 a sinner, breaking him with his teeth, 57 so that he made three of them suffer thus.
**Sanskrit:**
53 Ṣaḍbhiścakṣubhiḥsa rudati sma, trayiṃśca hanubhiḥ 54 aśrūṇi raktaśca śleṣmā ca pravahanti sma.
55 Sarvābhyo mukhebhyaḥ, cakrikāyām iva, sa 56 pāpīṃścakr̥dhanaḥ khaṇḍayām āsa dantaiḥ, 57 yathā trayaḥ evaṃ duḥkhitāḥ abhavan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 A quel dinanzi il mordere era nulla 59 verso ’l graffiar, che talvolta la schiena 60 rimanea de la pelle tutta brulla.
query.result:
**English:**
58 That day, the biting was nothing 59 compared to the scratching, which sometimes left 60 the back completely bare of skin.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Tad dinād agre daśanam tu mithyā 59 ākramaṇāt, yat kadācit prṣṭham 60 carmaṇā sarveṇa śūnyam abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 «Quell’ anima là sù c’ha maggior pena», 62 disse ’l maestro, «è Giuda Scarïotto, 63 che ’l capo ha dentro e fuor le gambe mena.
query.result:
**English:**
61 "That soul up there who suffers the greatest pain," 62 said the master, "is Judas Iscariot, 63 whose head is inside and whose legs kick outside.
**Sanskrit:**
61 Sātmā tatra upari yaḥ adhikaṃ duḥkham anubhavati, 62 āha guruḥ, "saḥ Judas Iscariot asti, 63 yasya śīrṣaṃ antas tiṣṭhati, jāṅghe tu bahiḥ calanti."

**English:**
64 Of the other two who have their heads down, 65 the one who hangs from the black snout is Brutus: 66 see how he writhes, and does not speak!
67 And the other is Cassius, who seems so strong-limbed.
**Sanskrit:**
64 Anyayoḥ dvayoḥ yayoḥ śiraḥ adhastāt asti, 65 yaḥ kṛṣṇāt syandanād avalambate sa Brutaḥ asti: 66 paśya katham sa vaṅkate, na ca śabdam karoti!
67 Aparaḥ ca Kaśyapaḥ, yaḥ evam balavān iva dṛśyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
68 Ma la notte risurge, e oramai 69 è da partir, ché tutto avem veduto».
70 Com’ a lui piacque, il collo li avvinghiai; 71 ed el prese di tempo e loco poste, 72 e quando l’ali fuoro aperte assai,
73 appigliò sé a le vellute coste; 74 di vello in vello giù discese poscia 75 tra ’l folto pelo e le gelate croste.
query.result:
**English:**
68 But night is rising, and it is time to leave, 69 for we have seen everything.
70 As he wished, I embraced his neck; 71 and he took me at a time and place he had chosen, 72 and when his wings were spread wide,
73 he clung to the hairy flanks; 74 then he descended down from hair to hair, 75 between the thick fur and the icy crusts.
**Sanskrit:**
68 Rātriḥ punarutpadyate, adhunā ca 69 Gantum asti, yataḥ sarvam adya paśyāmaḥ.
70 Yathā tasya rocate, tasya grīvāṃ pariṣvajāmi; 71 Sa ca kālam sthānam ca nītvā, 72 Yatra tasya pakṣau vistīrṇau bhavatas,
73 Tatra svayam romamayebhyaḥ parśvebhyaḥ āśrayate; 74 Romāṇi romāṇi adhastāt avatirṇo 'sti, 75 Gaḍha-roma-madhye hima-khaṇḍānāṃ madhye ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 Quando noi fummo là dove la coscia 77 si volge, a punto in sul grosso de l’anche, 78 lo duca, con fatica e con angoscia,
79 volse la testa ov’ elli avea le zanche, 80 e aggrappossi al pel com’ om che sale, 81 sì che ’n inferno i’ credea tornar anche.
query.result:
**English:**
76 When we were there where the thigh 77 turns, at the point on the thick part of the haunch, 78 the leader, with effort and with anguish,
79 turned his head where he had his legs, 80 and clutched the hair like a man who climbs, 81 so that I thought I was returning to hell again.
**Sanskrit:**
76 Yada vayam tatra āsiṣma yatra ūruḥ 77 parivartate, sthāne sthūla-aṅghreḥ agre, 78 netā, śrameṇa ca śokena ca,
79 śiraḥ paryāvartayad yatra tasya janghe āstām, 80 ca āśliṣṭavān keśān iva naraḥ yaḥ ārohati, 81 yathā narake aham manye punar āgacchāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 «Attienti ben, ché per cotali scale», 83 disse ’l maestro, ansando com’ uom lasso, 84 «conviensi dipartir da tanto male».
query.result:
**English:**
82 "Pay close attention, for by such stairs," 83 said the master, panting like a weary man, 84 "one must depart from so much evil."
**Sanskrit:**
82 "Śṛṇu samyak, yataḥ etadṛśebhiḥ śreṇibhiḥ," 83 uvāca guruḥ, śvāsaṃ gṛhṇan iva śrāntaḥ puruṣaḥ, 84 "etad atiduḥkhāt pramucyate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Poi uscì fuor per lo fóro d’un sasso 86 e puose me in su l’orlo a sedere; 87 appresso porse a me l’accorto passo.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 «Lèvati sù», disse ’l maestro, «in piede: 95 la via è lunga e ’l cammino è malvagio, 96 e già il sole a mezza terza riede».
query.result:
**English:**
94 "Arise," said the master, "on your feet: 95 the way is long and the journey is difficult, 96 and already the sun returns to mid-morning."
**Sanskrit:**
94 "Uttiṣṭha," āha guruḥ, "utthāya tiṣṭha: 95 Dīrgho mārgaḥ kaṣṭaśca pravāhaḥ, 96 Adyāpi sūryaḥ madhyātṛtīyāṃ prāpnoti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Non era camminata di palagio 98 là ’v’ eravam, ma natural burella 99 ch’avea mal suolo e di lume disagio.
query.result:
**English:**
97 It was not a journey of a palace, 98 where we were, but a natural sinkhole, 99 which had a bad floor and a lack of light.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Na khalu prapāsādapraviṣṭasyaivamātmānaḥpatanaṃbhavet, 98 yatra vayam āsīma, kim tu svābhāvikī guhā, 99 yasyāḥ kuṭilam sthānam āsīt prakāśasya ca abhāvaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 «Prima ch’io de l’abisso mi divella, 101 maestro mio», diss’ io quando fui dritto, 102 «a trarmi d’erro un poco mi favella:
103 ov’ è la ghiaccia? e questi com’ è fitto 104 sì sottosopra? e come, in sì poc’ ora, 105 da sera a mane ha fatto il sol tragitto?».
query.result:
**English:**
100 "Before I pull myself out of the abyss, 101 my master," I said when I was upright, 102 "speak to me a little to free me from error:
103 where is the ice? and how is this one fixed 104 upside down? and how, in such a short time, 105 has the sun made its journey from evening to morning?"
**Sanskrit:**
100 "Pūrvam yāvad aham apāye mām uddharāmi, 101 he gurudeva," iti ahaṃ abraviṃ yadā samyak sthitaḥ abhavam, 102 "mama bhrama-nivṛttyartham kimcid vaktavyam tvayā:
103 kva himaḥ? ayam ca katham evam niyuktaḥ 104 adhomukhaḥ? katham ca, ityanta alpasaṃkṣipte kāle, 105 sandhyākālāt prātaḥkālam āgataḥ sūryaḥ?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Ed elli a me: «Tu imagini ancora 107 d’esser di là dal centro, ov’ io mi presi 108 al pel del vermo reo che ’l mondo fóra.
query.result:
**English:**
106 And he to me: "You still imagine 107 that you are on the other side of the center, where I seized 108 the hair of the wicked worm that pierces the world.
**Sanskrit:**
106 Sa ca mama: "Tvam adhunāpi manyase 107 Pare 'smin madhye vartate yatra aham agṛhṇam 108 Keśān pāpīyasya kṛmeḥ yaḥ jagat vidhyati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Di là fosti cotanto quant’ io scesi; 110 quand’ io mi volsi, tu passasti ’l punto 111 al qual si traggon d’ogne parte i pesi.
query.result:
**English:**
109 You were there as long as I descended; 110 when I turned, you passed the point 111 to which all weights are drawn from every side.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Tataḥ tvam tāvatkālam āsīr yāvat aham avaruhya āgamanam; 110 yadā aham pratyavartatām, tadā tvam tam binduṃ atītayāḥ 111 yasmin samastāni bhārāṇi sarvataḥ ākrṣyante.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 E se’ or sotto l’emisperio giunto 113 ch’è contraposto a quel che la gran secca 114 coverchia, e sotto ’l cui colmo consunto
115 fu l’uom che nacque e visse sanza pecca; 116 tu haï i piedi in su picciola spera 117 che l’altra faccia fa de la Giudecca.
query.result:
**English:**
112 And if you have now arrived beneath the hemisphere 113 that is opposite to the one that the great expanse of dry land 114 covers, and beneath whose summit he was conceived and lived without sin; 115 you have your feet on a small sphere 116 that forms the other face of Judea.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Atha vā yadi tvam adhunā prāptaḥ asi adhastāt tasya golasya 113 yaḥ viparītaḥ asti tasmāt yasya mahān mṛttikāmayaḥ pradeśaḥ 114 ācchādayati, yasya ca śikhara-agre kṣīṇaḥ 115 sa naraḥ jajñe ca ajīvac ca anāgasam; 116 tava pādāḥ santi laghu-gole 117 yaḥ anyām mūrttiṃ karoti Yahuḍiyāyāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Qui è da man, quando di là è sera; 119 e questi, che ne fé scala col pelo, 120 fitto è ancora sì come prim’ era.
query.result:
**English:**
118 Here it is morning, while there it is evening; 119 and he who made a ladder for us with his hair, 120 is still fixed in the same way as he was before.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Iha prātaḥ asti, yatra tatra sāyam asti; 119 Saḥ ca, yaḥ asmābhiḥ keśaiḥ śreṇīṃ cakāra, 120 Saḥ adhunāpi pūrvavat sthitaḥ eva asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Da questa parte cadde giù dal cielo; 122 e la terra, che pria di qua si sporse, 123 per paura di lui fé del mar velo,
124 e venne a l’emisperio nostro; e forse 125 per fuggir lui lasciò qui loco vòto 126 quella ch’appar di qua, e sù ricorse».
query.result:
**English:**
121 From this side he fell down from heaven; 122 and the earth, which had previously extended on this side, 123 out of fear of him made a veil of the sea,
124 and came to our hemisphere; and perhaps 125 to flee from him she left here a void space 126 that which appears on this side, and ran back up.
**Sanskrit:**
121 Asmāt pakṣāt sa svargāt patitaḥ; 122 Prithivī ca, yā pūrvam atra vistṛtā āsīt, 123 Tasya bhayāt samudrasya āvaraṇam cakāra,
124 Atha asmākam ardhagobhaṃ prāpta; tataś ca 125 Tam parityajya śūnyam sthānam atra tyaktvā 126 Yā atra dṛśyate, sā ūrdhvam dhāvati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Luogo è là giù da Belzebù remoto 128 tanto quanto la tomba si distende, 129 che non per vista, ma per suono è noto
130 d’un ruscelletto che quivi discende 131 per la buca d’un sasso, ch’elli ha roso, 132 col corso ch’elli avvolge, e poco pende.
query.result:
**English:**
127 The place is down there, far from Beelzebub, 128 as far as the tomb extends, 129 which is known not by sight, but by sound,
130 of a small stream that descends there 131 through the hole of a rock, which it has eroded, 132 with its winding course, and a slight slope.
**Sanskrit:**
127 Sthānaṃ tatra adhastād Belzebūtaḥ dūre 128 yāvad ghaṭikā vistṛtā asti, 129 yat darśanena na, śabdena tu vijñāyate,
130 ekasya nadi-pravāhasya yat tatra ava-gacchati 131 ekaśilā-vidhurasya, yām sa kṣīṇām cakāra, 132 yasya pravāhena sa āvṛtaḥ asti, alpam ca ava-namataḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Lo duca e io per quel cammino ascoso 134 intrammo a ritornar nel chiaro mondo; 135 e sanza cura aver d’alcun riposo,
136 salimmo sù, el primo e io secondo, 137 tanto ch’i’ vidi de le cose belle 138 che porta ’l ciel, per un pertugio tondo.
query.result:
**English:**
133 The leader and I, by that hidden path, 134 entered to return to the bright world; 135 and without caring to take any rest,
136 we climbed up, he first and I second, 137 so much that I saw of the beautiful things 138 that heaven bears, through a round opening.
**Sanskrit:**
133 Duṣṭaḥ ca aham ca tena mārgeṇa guhyena 134 praviṣṭāv ubhau prakāśalokam prati pratyāvartane, 135 viśrāmasya ca kāṅkṣāṃ na kṛtvā,
136 ārohaṇam cakratuḥ sa pūrvaḥ aham ca paścāt, 137 yāvat aham dṛṣṭavān lokān śubhān 138 yaḥ bibharti nabhaḥ, vṛttavivareṇa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 E quindi uscimmo a riveder le stelle.
query.result:
**English:**
139 And so we emerged to see the stars again.
**Sanskrit:**
139 Evaṃ ca vayam niṣkrāntāḥ punar api tārāḥ draṣṭum.
